clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring Technology in the Perioperative Period During Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Trial of Continuous Glucose Monitoring Technology in the Perioperative Period During Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study of continuous glucose monitoring technology during cardiac surgery. The investigators would like to develop data for descriptive analysis of a comparison of continuous glucose monitoring with a gold standard under the conditions of cardiac surgery.

clinical_study.why_stopped: On further investigation, it was found that the continuous glucose monitors required a calibration period that precluded reliable data collection.

arm_group.description: Competent Adult Patients going for elective cardiac surgery.

intervention.intervention_name: Use of continuous glucose monitor during surgery. ( Medtronic Minimed Guardian REALTime Continuous Glucose Monitor)
intervention.description: Use of continuous glucose monitor during surgery.
intervention.other_name: Medtronic Minimed Guardian REALTime Continuous Glucose Monitor

study_pop.textblock: Competent adults scheduled for elective cardiac surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Competent adults scheduled for elective cardiac surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to consent, emergency surgery.
